tests.title: integration test between client and server
tests.fullTitle: Socket/Client integration test between client and server
tests.code:
const
Debug         = require('@superhero/debug'),
log           = new Debug({ debug:true }),
SocketServer  = require('./server'),
socketServer  = SocketServer.from(log),
SocketClient  = require('./client'),
socketClient  = SocketClient.from(log),
port          = 18200,
event         = 'foobar',
body          = { foo:'bar' }
socketServer.listen(port)
socketClient.connect(port)
socketClient.emit(event, body)
socketServer.on(event, (context, data) =>
{
  expect(data).to.deep.equal(body)
  socketClient.client.end()
  socketServer.server.close()
  done()
})

tests.title: possible to remove a listener
tests.fullTitle: Socket/Client possible to remove a listener
tests.code:
const
Debug         = require('@superhero/debug'),
log           = new Debug({ debug:false }),
SocketClient  = require('./client'),
socketClient  = SocketClient.from(log),
event         = 'foobar',
listener      = () => {}
expect(socketClient.connectionObserver.dispatcher.events.listenerCount(event)).to.deep.equal(0)
socketClient.on(event, listener)
expect(socketClient.connectionObserver.dispatcher.events.listenerCount(event)).to.deep.equal(1)
socketClient.removeListener(event, listener)
expect(socketClient.connectionObserver.dispatcher.events.listenerCount(event)).to.deep.equal(0)

tests.title: attach data event to dispatcher with a context
tests.fullTitle: Socket/ConnectionObserver attach data event to dispatcher with a context
tests.code:
const
Debug               = require('@superhero/debug'),
log                 = new Debug({ debug:false }),
Events              = require('events'),
events              = new Events,
ConnectionObserver  = require('./connection-observer'),
connectionObserver  = ConnectionObserver.from(log, events),
NetSocket           = require('net').Socket,
netSocket           = new NetSocket,
dispatcher          = connectionObserver.dispatcher,
emitter             = connectionObserver.emitter,
SocketContext       = require('./context'),
socketContext       = SocketContext.from(netSocket, emitter)
expect(netSocket.listenerCount('data')).to.be.equal(0)
connectionObserver.attachDataEventToDispatcherWithAContext(netSocket, dispatcher, context)
expect(netSocket.listenerCount('data')).to.be.equal(1)

tests.title: log socket events
tests.code:
const
Debug               = require('@superhero/debug'),
log                 = new Debug({ debug:false }),
Events              = require('events'),
events              = new Events,
ConnectionObserver  = require('./connection-observer'),
connectionObserver  = ConnectionObserver.from(log, events),
NetSocket           = require('net').Socket,
netSocket           = new NetSocket,
emitter             = connectionObserver.emitter
for(const event of ['close','connection','drain','lookup','timeout','error'])
  expect(event + netSocket.listenerCount(event)).to.be.equal(event + 0)
connectionObserver.logSocketEvents(netSocket, log)
for(const event of ['close','connection','drain','lookup','timeout','error'])
  expect(event + netSocket.listenerCount(event)).to.be.equal(event + 1)

tests.title: the "onConnection" function attaches the expected listeners
tests.fullTitle: Socket/ConnectionObserver the "onConnection" function attaches the expected listeners
tests.code:
const
Debug               = require('@superhero/debug'),
log                 = new Debug({ debug:false }),
Events              = require('events'),
events              = new Events,
ConnectionObserver  = require('./connection-observer'),
connectionObserver  = ConnectionObserver.from(log, events),
NetSocket           = require('net').Socket,
netSocket           = new NetSocket
for(const event of ['close','connection','drain','lookup','timeout','error','data'])
  expect(event + netSocket.listenerCount(event)).to.be.equal(event + 0)
connectionObserver.onConnection(netSocket)
for(const event of ['close','connection','drain','lookup','timeout','error','data'])
  expect(event + netSocket.listenerCount(event)).to.be.equal(event + 1)

tests.title: expected format
tests.code:
const
Debug         = require('@superhero/debug'),
log           = new Debug({ debug:false }),
Emitter       = require('./emitter'),
emitter       = Emitter.from(log),
NetSocket     = require('net').Socket,
netSocket     = new NetSocket,
SocketContext = require('./context'),
socketContext = SocketContext.from(netSocket, emitter),
PayloadStack  = require('./payload-stack')
expect(socketContext.socket).deep.equal(netSocket)
expect(socketContext.emit).to.be.a('function')
expect(socketContext.payloadStack).to.be.an.instanceof(PayloadStack)

tests.title: handle error
tests.code:
const
Debug                   = require('@superhero/debug'),
log                     = new Debug({ debug:false }),
Dispatcher              = require('./dispatcher'),
dispatcher              = Dispatcher.from(log),
IncompleteMessageError  = require('./payload-stack/error/incomplete-message'),
incompleteMessageError  = new IncompleteMessageError,
error                   = new Error,
callbackThrows          = dispatcher.handleError.bind(dispatcher, error),
callbackDoesNotThrow    = dispatcher.handleError.bind(dispatcher, incompleteMessageError)
expect(callbackThrows).to.throw()
expect(callbackDoesNotThrow).to.not.throw()

tests.title: loop through context buffer to dispatch each message one by one
tests.fullTitle: Socket/Dispatcher loop through context buffer to dispatch each message one by one
tests.code:
const
Debug             = require('@superhero/debug'),
log               = new Debug({ debug:false }),
SocketDispatcher  = require('./dispatcher'),
socketDispatcher  = SocketDispatcher.from(log),
SocketPayload     = require('./payload-stack/payload'),
event             = 'foobar',
body              = { foo:'bar' },
buffer            = SocketPayload.from(event, body).toBuffer(),
SocketEmitter     = require('./emitter'),
socketEmitter     = SocketEmitter.from(log),
port              = 18200,
netClient         = require('net').createConnection({ port }),
netServer         = require('net').createServer().listen(port),
SocketContext     = require('./context'),
socketContext     = SocketContext.from(netClient, socketEmitter)
socketContext.payloadStack.push(buffer, buffer)
netClient.on('connect', () => socketDispatcher.loopThroughContextBufferToDispatchEachMessageOneByOne(socketContext))
let i = 0
socketDispatcher.events.on(event, (context, data) =>
{
  if(++i === 2)
  {
    expect(data).to.deep.equal(body)
    netClient.end()
    netServer.close()
    done()
  }
})

tests.title: write buffer to socket
tests.code:
const
Debug     = require('@superhero/debug'),
log       = new Debug({ debug:false }),
Emitter   = require('./emitter'),
emitter   = Emitter.from(log),
port      = 18200,
netClient = require('net').createConnection({ port }),
netServer = require('net').createServer().listen(port),
buffer    = Buffer.from('foobar')
netClient.on('connect', async () =>
{
  await emitter.writeBufferToSocket(netClient, buffer)
})
netServer.on('connection', (socket) =>
{
  socket.on('data', (data) =>
  {
    expect(data.toString()).to.be.equal(buffer.toString())
    socket.end()
    netServer.close()
  })
})
netServer.on('close', () => done())

tests.title: emit event with data
tests.code:
const
PayloadStack  = require('./payload-stack'),
payloadStack  = PayloadStack.from(),
Debug         = require('@superhero/debug'),
log           = new Debug({ debug:false }),
Emitter       = require('./emitter'),
emitter       = Emitter.from(log),
port          = 18200,
netClient     = require('net').createConnection({ port }),
netServer     = require('net').createServer().listen(port),
event         = 'foobar',
body          = { foo:'bar' }
netClient.on('connect', async () =>
{
  await emitter.emit(netClient, event, body)
})
netServer.on('connection', (socket) =>
{
  socket.on('data', (data) =>
  {
    payloadStack.push(data)
    const dto = payloadStack.shift()
    expect(dto.event).to.be.equal(event)
    expect(dto.data).to.deep.equal(body)
    socket.end()
    netServer.close()
  })
})
netServer.on('close', () => done())

tests.title: is of expected type
tests.code:
const
IncompleteMessageError = require('./incomplete-message'),
error = new IncompleteMessageError
expect(error).to.be.an.instanceof(Error)

tests.title: has expected error code
tests.code:
const
IncompleteMessageError = require('./incomplete-message'),
error = new IncompleteMessageError
expect(error.code).to.be.equal('ERR_INCOMPLETE_MESSAGE')

tests.title: push and shift message from buffer stack
tests.fullTitle: Socket/PayloadStack push and shift message from buffer stack
tests.code:
const
SocketPayloadStack  = require('./index'),
socketPayloadStack  = SocketPayloadStack.from(),
foo                 = 'foobar',
data                = { foo:'bar' },
SocketPayload       = require('./payload'),
socketPayload       = SocketPayload.from(foo, data),
buffer              = socketPayload.toBuffer()
socketPayloadStack.push(buffer)
const message = socketPayloadStack.shift()
expect(message.event).to.be.equal(foo)
expect(message.data).deep.equal(data)
expect(socketPayloadStack.stack.length).to.be.equal(0)

tests.title: shift a message from the buffer stack that holds a broken message
tests.fullTitle: Socket/PayloadStack shift a message from the buffer stack that holds a broken message
tests.code:
const
SocketPayloadStack  = require('./index'),
socketPayloadStack  = SocketPayloadStack.from(),
event               = 'foobar',
data                = { foo:'bar' },
SocketPayload       = require('./payload'),
socketPayload       = SocketPayload.from(event, data),
buffer              = socketPayload.toBuffer().slice(20),
callback            = socketPayloadStack.shift.bind(socketPayloadStack)
socketPayloadStack.push(buffer)
expect(callback).to.throw(Error).with.property('code', 'ERR_INCOMPLETE_MESSAGE')

tests.title: is mutable
tests.code:
const
event = 'foobar',
data  = { foo:'bar' },
SocketPayload = require('./index'),
socketPayload = SocketPayload.from(event, data)
socketPayload.event = 'barbaz'
expect(socketPayload.event).to.be.equal(event)

tests.title: can be represented as a buffer
tests.fullTitle: Socket/PayloadStack/Payload can be represented as a buffer
tests.code:
const
event = 'foobar',
data  = { foo:'bar' },
SocketPayload = require('./index'),
socketPayload = SocketPayload.from(event, data)
socketPayload.event = 'barbaz'
expect(socketPayload.toBuffer.bind(socketPayload)).to.not.throw()

tests.title: buffer has a header that describes the correct length of the buffer
tests.fullTitle: Socket/PayloadStack/Payload buffer has a header that describes the correct length of the buffer
tests.code:
const
event = 'foobar',
data  = { foo:'bar' },
SocketPayload = require('./index'),
socketPayload = SocketPayload.from(event, data),
buffer = socketPayload.toBuffer(),
length = buffer.readInt32BE(0)
expect(SocketPayload.HEADER_SIZE + length).to.be.equal(buffer.length)

tests.title: integration test between server and client
tests.fullTitle: Socket/Server integration test between server and client
tests.code:
const
Debug   = require('@superhero/debug'),
log     = new Debug({ debug:false }),
Server  = require('./server'),
server  = Server.from(log),
Client  = require('./client'),
client  = Client.from(log),
port    = 18200,
event   = 'foobar',
body    = { foo:'bar' }
server.listen(port)
client.connect(port)
client.emit(event, body)
server.on(event, (context, data) =>
{
  expect(data).to.deep.equal(body)
  context.emit(event, body)
})
client.on(event, (context, data) =>
{
  expect(data).to.deep.equal(body)
  client.client.end()
  server.server.close()
  done()
})

tests.title: possible to remove a listener
tests.fullTitle: Socket/Server possible to remove a listener
tests.code:
const
Debug         = require('@superhero/debug'),
log           = new Debug({ debug:false }),
SocketServer  = require('./server'),
socketServer  = SocketServer.from(log),
event         = 'foobar',
listener      = () => {}
expect(socketServer.connectionObserver.dispatcher.events.listenerCount(event)).to.deep.equal(0)
socketServer.on(event, listener)
expect(socketServer.connectionObserver.dispatcher.events.listenerCount(event)).to.deep.equal(1)
socketServer.removeListener(event, listener)
expect(socketServer.connectionObserver.dispatcher.events.listenerCount(event)).to.deep.equal(0)
